results.title: A Tale of the fiords: a story to see and hear
results.brief_description: A re-edit of a Swedish film originally produced by Arne Sucksdorff. A Norwegian tale about little Ragnhild who yearns to find the legendary valley ofdreams across the fiord. She slips away from her task of milking goats on the mountainside and dreams that she has found her valley.

results.title: A Tale of summer
results.brief_description: The quiet countryside is always close at hand in Sweden, irrespective of whether a person lives in a big town or in a small village. Thanks to a special law opening up private land to the general public, you can go almost anywhere without hindrance. Arne Sucksdorff, photographer and film director, tells of the fantastic adventures of a small fox cub in the Swedish Wood in early summer.

results.title: A System for Handling Sport Injuries
results.brief_description: Sport injuries occur regardless of the age or skill of the athlete or the level of competition. This film provides a comprehensive approach to the many types of sports injuries that can occur in any sporting event and outlines a system for determining injury type and the immediate forms of treatment applicable.

results.title: A Sugar-cane farm in Fiji
results.creator_credit: Concept Films of Australia and Pilgrim Productions
results.brief_description: Presents a case study of a sugar cane farm in Fiji as an example of cane farming. The yearly agricultural program and mill processes are covered. Also considers the importance of sugar cane to the Fijian economy.

results.title: A Study of crystals using microscopic fusion methods
results.creator_credit: Gilbert Altschul Productions and Journal Films
results.brief_description: Depicts fusion methods in chemical research using live-action laboratory sequences, animation and microphotography; also shows patterns of crystal growth under the microscope.

results.title: A Street is witness
results.brief_description: The film includes a general history of the erection of “The Wall” separating East and West Berlin and focuses on Bernauer Strasse where the street, although part of West Berlin, contains houses down one side which belong to the Soviet sector. This street has seen many tragedies since August 13, 1961, when the wall was erected.

results.title: A Strand breaks
results.brief_description: Traces the consequences of a state of imbalance in nature. The destruction of a community as a consequence of one element getting out of hand is carefully traced in regard to both forest and grassland. The results of overgrazing and hunting are illustrated and the point made that only by intelligent management can we secure the heritage of the soil.

results.title: A Story of sirex noctilio
results.creator_credit: Ted Davis and Victoria. Dept. of Agriculture
results.brief_description: The wood-boring wasp sirex noctilio lays its eggs in pine sapwood and infects the tree with a destructive fungus. The pest is established in Tasmania and has been found in Victoria since 1961. Control measures are shown, such as quarantine, burning infected trees and inspection. Research is in progress on the possibility of breeding resistant strains of trees, and on biological control by imported predatory wasps.

results.creator_credit: Charles L. Finance and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
